alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 05 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL ANNE ARUNDEL...NORTHEASTERN HOWARD AND SOUTHWESTERN BALTIMORE COUNTIES AND WESTERN BALTIMORE CITY... At 600 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Arbutus, or near Baltimore, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Baltimore, Columbia, Elkridge, Baltimore-Washington Airport, Historic Ellicott City, Ellicott City, Catonsville, Woodlawn, Milford Mill, Lochearn, Arbutus, Ferndale, Brooklyn Park, Pumphrey, Ilchester, Linthicum, Lansdowne, Hanover, Oella and Halethorpe. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
